title: NASA’s Chandra Sees Surprisingly Strong Black Hole Jet at Cosmic “Noon”
description: A black hole has blasted out a surprisingly powerful jet in the distant universe, according to a new study from NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory and discussed in our latest press release. This jet exists early enough in the cosmos that it is being illuminated by the leftover glow from the big bang itself. Astronomers used […]
author: Lee Mohon

title: Central Brazil Cerrado
description: On May 19, 2025, Landsat 9 captured this image of the Serra de Caldas in the state of Goiás, Brazil. The oval plateau is covered by a biologically rich savanna and grassland ecosystem called Cerrado. The Cerrado covers about one-fifth of Brazil’s land area and represents the second-largest biome in South America behind the Amazon. These lands […]
author: Monika Luabeya

title: Starlink satellites are leaking radio signals that may ruin astronomy
description: Our ability to study faint radio signals from when the first stars began to form is being threatened by SpaceX's Starlink satellites, which seem to be unintentionally leaking radio signals that overpower astronomers' telescopes

title: Life of first US woman in space Sally Ride makes a moving documentary
description: A new documentary sheds light on the extraordinary story of the US's first woman astronaut, Sally Ride, who defied all expectations in both her career and personal life

title: India to send first astronaut on mission to International Space Station
description: Shubhanshu Shukla is part of four-person mission launching on Tuesday from USThe first Indian astronaut to visit the International Space Station is due to blast off as part of an effort by the world’s most populous nation to catch up with the US, Russia and China in human space flight missions.Shubhanshu Shukla, a 39-year-old air force fighter pilot, is is part of four-person mission launching on Tuesday from the US with the private company Axiom Space, which is using a SpaceX capsule. Continue reading...
author: Oliver Holmes

title: Starwatch: sanguine Antares contrasts with silver light of the moon
description: Shining blood red above the horizon in the UK, the star is 15th brightest in night sky and 15 times mass of the sunSummer in the UK and similar northern latitudes is the best time of year to catch sight of the zodiacal constellation Scorpius, the scorpion. The constellation contains the beautiful star Antares. Shining blood-red just above the southern horizon, Antares is a prize well worth tracking down and this week, the moon helps point it out.The chart shows the view looking south from London at 23:00 BST on 9 June. The moon will be cruising through the constellation and Antares will be unmistakable, its sanguine hues contrasting beautifully with the silver light of the Earth’s natural satellite. Continue reading...
author: Stuart Clark

title: NASA raises the odds that an asteroid could hit the moon in 2032
description: Asteroid 2024 YR4, once the highest impact risk ever recorded, now poses no threat to Earth but has a slightly increased chance of striking the moon in 2032.
author: Sharmila Kuthunur

title: How to see the 'Horse and Rider' in the Big Dipper's handle this summer
description: Mizar, a star in the Big Dipper's handle, has a tiny companion. This star, Alcor, was known to the ancients. The pair was popularly known as the "Horse and Rider."
author: Joe Rao
